title: Senior Network Engineer
content:
Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isnâ€™t just the Best Place to Play â€” itâ€™s also the Best Place to Work. Today, weâ€™re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStationÂ®5, PlayStationÂ®4, PlayStationÂ®VR, PlayStationÂ®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.
PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.
The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.Senior Network EngineerLondon
As the lead member of the IT Network Engineering team you will be developing and maintaining global enterprise network architecture to ensure a consistently excellent network user experience to PlayStationâ€™s employees around the world. 
Core Responsibilities 
Develop and maintain standard reference network architecture for the global enterprise network 
Serve as technical lead for global enterprise network strategies and initiatives 
Lead all aspects of the development and implementation of PoCs to validate enterprise network solutions 
Lead all aspects of network vendor selection 
Lead all aspects of the development and maintenance of physical network component standards (e.g. network facilities, network media, network device peripherals, etc.) 
Contribute as a key member to the development of SIEâ€™s network security standards 
Collaborate with SIE security architecture and policy teams to ensure that security and network standards are aligned 
Collaborate with SIEâ€™s non-enterprise network teams to ensure alignment across diverse SIE network environments 
Collaborate on large IT projects to ensure that network components of those projects are aligned efficiently with SIEâ€™s enterprise network standards and capabilities 
Review and contribute on designs created by other network engineers to ensure they meet SIEâ€™s global enterprise network standards 
Rack, build, and configure network appliances at SIE offices and datacenters.  
Mentor Junior to Senior level engineers in regards to SIEâ€™s enterprise network standards and industry trends. 
Required Experience 
10+ years of progressive experience in the enterprise networking field 
5 + years of experience in architecting enterprise network solutions 
Broad networking knowledge, covering many network equipment vendors and components of the enterprise network 
Deep understanding of network fundamentals (e.g. TCP/IP, Ethernet, IP Addressing/Subnetting, VLANs, etc.) 
Advanced experience implementing common routing protocols (e.g. BGP, OSPF, EIGRP) 
Advanced experience implementing zone based firewalls and configuring security policies. 
Knowledgeable with Cloud Networking concepts with experience In both AWS and Azure environments 
 Desirable Experience 
Fluent with Juniper QFX and EX series platforms. 
Experience with Ivanti Secure and Global Protect remote access VPN 
Experience with Palo Alto Networks firewalls, central management through Panorama. 
Experience with Network Access Control solutions  
Experience working with global teams 
Experience with integrating networks from acquisitions 
Experience with network automation and source control 
Benefits: 
Discretionary bonus opportunity 
Hybrid Working (within Flexmodes) 
Private Medical Insurance 
Dental Scheme 
25 days holiday per year 
On Site Gym 
Subsidised CafÃ© 
On site bar 
Access to cycle garage and showers 
Equal Opportunity Statement:
Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.
We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.
PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

demographic_questions.header: UK Diversity & Inclusion - Voluntary Equal Opportunity Monitoring
demographic_questions.description:
Sony Interactive Entertainment Europe Limited (‘SIEE’) is committed to ensuring that all job applicants and members of staff are treated equally, without discrimination because of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partner status, gender reassignment, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, disability or age. Collecting diversity data is intended to help SIEE maintain equal opportunities best practice and identify barriers to workforce equality and diversity. Please read this notification and consent before you decide whether to submit your diversity data in the survey below. 

SIEE will treat all survey responses in the strictest confidence, and our personnel with decision-making role in the recruitment process can only see aggregated reports on the results of the survey and cannot allocate these aggregated reports to individual applicants. There is no obligation on you to provide diversity data, SIEE will treat all applicants the same regardless of whether they provide diversity data or not, and any responses to the survey will not affect our decision on your application.

You can withdraw your consent at any time. The withdrawal of your consent does not affect the lawfulness of the processing of your diversity data based on your consent before its withdrawal.
